topic.title: How to update my zeroblog, which I cloned from zeroblog?
topic.body: Is there any simple way to update my zeroblog? I didn't find any button on my blog.

1_1UfvLnMuzShvi3phWGSqn79tio81Wn9Dt.body: 我比较希望能有一个社交化的blog。可以相互关注，可以相互留言，类似twitter。这样既解决了blog的信息孤岛问题，又有了保存别人网站的动力（粉丝保存关注者的动力还是很强的）。
我有兴趣做社交化的内容，可是看了看zeronet，感觉难度对于我来说实在太大了。如果有高手在做这方面的事情，我可以帮忙打下手，呵呵

2_1L4fuhUB75eAdVbDY9AJ4z2i2dwMho7MV8.body:
> [nofish](#comment_300_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Not UI yet, but it's really easy:
> 
> Backup your data/yoursiteaddress directory (just in case)
> Copy and overwrite every file and directory from data/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8 to data/yoursiteaddress except data directory and content.json 
> Sign + Publish your site using the sidebar.

Thanks very much. Your response is so fast:)

43_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD.body: Yes, zeronet is awesome. It can't be blocked by the China Great Firewall. While most sites which Chinese can make free speech have been blocked by China Great Firewall.
But the Great Firewall is very effective as reddit user mentioned. I hope Zeronet can defend the attack of Great Firewall in the future.

> [yo](#comment_16_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD): http://127.0.0.1:43110/gfwtalk.bit/?Topic:17_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD/+How+the+Great+Firewall+discovers+hidden+circumvention+servers
Zeronet is a p2p network, I think it's different than normal hidden circumvention servers. In other words, Zeronet has a lot of hidden circumvention servers. Block all the Zeronet servers will be a big cost for GFW.

> [erkan](#comment_142_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): To all of you who say ZeroNet can not be blocked/shutdown/...:
> did you see yet G011 from ZeroSecurity?If I were the Chinese government, I'd start by blocking/redirecting those 8 trackers first.

This is really a weakness of Zeronet. But it seems can be improved in the future.

Below is @nofish's comment on reddit:
==============================================
Every P2P network requires an initial node to get IP addresses (for example Bitcoin using this hard-coded ones), so you can't get around of this, but later it can be improved (for example adding more tor/i2p bootstrap nodes)
